text: Paa Kwesi Bekoe Amissah-Arthur (29 April 1951 â€“ 29 June 2018) was a Ghanaian economist, academic and politician. He was the fifth Vice-President of Ghana's 4th Republic, in office from 6 August 2012 until 7 January 2017, under President John Dramani Mahama. Before, he was Governor of the Bank of Ghana from 2009 to 2012. He was born in Cape Coast. Amissah-Arthur died of a heart attack in Accra on 29 June 2018, aged 67. ==Related pages== *List of scientists from Africa ==References== Category:1951 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Vice presidents of Ghana Category:Ghanaian educators Category:Economists
title: Kwesi Amissah-Arthur
